Example: Bayes' formula (2)
Another illustration of the use of Bayes' formula may make it easier to remember
and apply. Consider the following possibilities. There is a 60% probability the
economy will outperform, and if it does, there is a 70% chance a stock will go up
and a 30% chance the stock will go down. There is a 40% chance the economy will
underperform, and if it does, there is a 20% chance the stock in question will increase
in value (have gains) and an 80% chance it will not. Let's diagram this situation.
